artist: Painter: After Peter Paul Rubens; Delineator: William Marshall Craig; Engraver: Charles Heath
description: Minerva protecting Peace against War; allegorical scene with Pax seated at center feeding a group of children; Minerva beyond fighting Mars; Satyr at lower left holding a corucopia and a leopard in center foreground trying to grab fruits; maenads far left
inscription:
Signature, Title, and Inscription 

above image in black: Class the Third  PEACE & WAR Schools of Germany, Flanders, & Holland & c. / 10 | below image in black: P.P. Rubens  9.8 by 6.5 / Drawn by W.M. Craig  Engraved by C. Heath / LONDON | on sheet in pencil: 2-330
provenance: John Crosby, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 1947.
title: Peace and War
